intro: Peperomia trineura, commonly known as the three-veined peperomia, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It features rounded, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a subtle reddish or purple tinge on the underside. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or brown, arranged in clusters along the stems. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its unique leaf venation and compact growth habit make it an attractive and low-maintenance houseplant.
